articles.author: Ankur Banerjee
articles.description: Asian stocks edged higher on Tuesday, while the dollar was at its lowest in three months as investors remained convinced the Federal Reserve was done with its rate-hike cycle and looked ahead to a crucial inflation report later this week.
articles.title: Asian stocks inch ahead as traders brace for inflation data

articles.author: Clark Mindock
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court on Monday handed 3M (MMM.N), Corteva Inc (CTVA.N) subsidiary E.I. du Pont de Nemours and Co and other manufactures of toxic so-called "forever chemicals" a big win in their fight against legal liability for the substances, rejecting a lower court's ruling that would have allowed about 11.8 million Ohio residents to sue the companies as a group.
articles.title: 3M, DuPont defeat massive class action over forever chemicals

articles.author: Ananya Mariam Rajesh, Deborah Sophia, Siddharth Cavale
articles.description: Spending online on Cyber Monday is set to exceed $12 billion, a record, as bargain hunters snap up deals on items including Barbie dolls, Lego sets, headphones and smart watches, according to preliminary estimates from Adobe Digital Insights.
articles.title: Deal-hunters on track to spend record $12 bln in US Cyber Monday shopping spree

articles.author: Sarah Young, Joanna Plucinska
articles.description: A Virgin Atlantic passenger jet flying from London to New York powered by 100% sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) will take off on Tuesday, as the aviation world seeks to showcase the potential of low carbon options to secure its future.
articles.title: Virgin Atlantic jet to lift off for maiden transatlantic flight on low-carbon fuel

articles.author: Alex Lawler, Ahmad Ghaddar
articles.description: OPEC+ is looking at deepening oil production cuts despite its policy meeting being postponed to this Thursday amid a quota disagreement between some producers, an OPEC+ source said on Monday.
articles.title: OPEC+ looking at deeper oil cuts ahead of Thursday meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A few dozen employees at fashion house Gucci in Rome went on strike on Monday against the company's decision to move its design office from the Italian capital to Milan.
articles.title: Gucci employees in Rome go on strike over creative office move

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday adopted a financial crisis-inspired rule barring traders in asset-backed securities from betting against the same assets they sell to investors.
articles.title: Wall St regulator adopts Dodd Frank rule against trader conflicts

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: An Israel-Hamas truce in Gaza was poised to stretch into a fifth day on Tuesday amid expectations the Islamist group will free more of the hostages it seized on Oct. 7 in return for greater aid flows and Israel's release of imprisoned Palestinians.
articles.title: More Israeli hostages, Palestinians expected to be freed with extended truce

articles.author: Joe Cash, Ellen Zhang, Kane Wu
articles.description: U.S. furniture company head Jordan England thinks his firm's Chinese suppliers are among the best in the game, but geopolitics and a slowing economy have pushed him to source more products from Southeast Asia, Eastern Europe and Mexico.
articles.title: West's de-risking starts to bite China's prospects

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: Idaho officials on Monday asked the U.S. Supreme Court to temporarily halt a federal judge's ruling that blocked the Republican-governed state from enforcing its near-total abortion ban in medical-emergency situations following a legal challenge by Democratic President Joe Biden's administration.
articles.title: Idaho asks US Supreme Court to allow near-total abortion ban
